alert.note: Alert for Central and East Adams and Arapahoe Counties; Elbert, Central and East Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet; Morgan County; North and Northeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, North Lincoln County; Southeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, South Lincoln County; Washington County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 5:43PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Elbert, eastern Arapahoe, eastern Morgan, western Washington, eastern Adams and northern Lincoln Counties through 615 PM MDT... At 543 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 3 miles west of Midway to 4 miles north of Kutch, or along a line extending from 13 miles west of Akron to 22 miles southwest of Limon. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Limon, Akron, Brush, Hugo, Hillrose, Genoa, Gary, Anton, Elba, Matheson, Woodlin School, Kutch, Cottonwood Valley, Lindon, Snyder, Midway, Last Chance, Woodrow and Punkin Center. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: Prepare for sudden gusty winds. Secure loose objects and move to a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM MDT for northeastern and east central Colorado.
